subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: banning spam
msgSnippet: Thanks Paige, I would guess that judging by the introductions and spam, it shouldn t be too onerous. I find that some unsubscriptions occur very quickly once
messageBody:
Thanks Paige,
I would guess that judging by the introductions and spam, it shouldn't
be too onerous. I find that some unsubscriptions occur very quickly once
they realise that newcomers are moderated!
-Andii

Paige Gabhart wrote:
> Andii:
>
> After giving this some thought, I have changed the group settings so
> that new members' posts will be moderated. I am hoping this will
> not be too onerous for me, and it will prevent the rest of you from
> seeing the spam.
>
> Paige
>
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Andii Bowsher
> <andiibowsher@b...> wrote:
>
>>The only way to deal with it is to change the group settings so
>
> that no
>
>>new subscriber may post without moderation or even join without
>
> approval
>
>>[or both]. Of course it still won't stop 'em stealing email
>
> addresses ....
>
>>-Andii
>>
>>Paige Gabhart wrote:
>>
>>>Dear Suebee:
>>>
>>>The Interest-rate spammer has been banned! I fear this may
>
> become like
>
>>>the boy trying to hold back the ocean with his finger in the
>
> dike. It
>
>>>would be satisfying if spammers were to be hit with significant
>>>penalties such as large fines for screwing up the utility of the
>>>internet. They're like a plague of locusts in their fecundity.
>>>
>>>
>>>Paige Gabhart
>>>
